page.title: 17Hogsthorpe Village.
page.content: In years past Hogsthorpe was known as a town and it was a thriving marsh community.It used to have a small toffee factory and many shops in the high street.Sheep grazed all round.It was bigger than Skegness untill the railway came.Today there are no sheep,only a few cows and the land thanks to the drainage improvements is used for barley,wheat,potatoes and rape seed.Mr Mcdonald is an excallent potter and runs a busines making his own attractive and unique pottery at Mill stone crafts.There is a small bakers still making and selling bread and buns but he only sells very localy now.Hogsthorpe has two pubs,the Saracens head,a free house and the Victoria Tarven whitch sells the local real ale beers.The Saracens have an excellent Tug o'War team,a popular sport in rural Lincolnshire.
